message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.SY. 

The paper describes a scheme for unsupervised learning in an agent-environment setting, which is a common topic in machine learning and artificial intelligence research. The use of self-play and reward structures suggests a focus on reinforcement learning (RL), which is often studied in the cs.LG and cs.AI sub-categories. The mention of environments that can be reset and the use of sequences of actions suggests a focus on robotics (cs.RO) or computer vision (cs.CV) applications. Finally, the mention of automatic curricula and intrinsic motivation suggests a focus on systems and control (cs.SY) or cognitive science (cs.CC) applications. Overall, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG and cs.AI, followed by cs.RO, cs.CV, and cs.SY.
